briefTitle: A Test to Determine the Usefulness and Safety of a Cream Used on Babies With Dry Itchy Skin

outcomeMeasures.title: Eczema Area and Severity Index (EASI) on Day 3 - Change From Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: The surface and severity of eczema is measured using the Eczema Area and Severity Index (EASI). A regional body surface area tabulation based on severity ranging from 0 (none) to 3 (severe), and severity of signs of disease, then multiplied by body area with final calculation ranging from 0-72.

outcomeMeasures.title: Investigator's Global Atopic Dermatitis Assessment (IGADA) on Day 3 - Change From Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: The signs and symptoms of eczema are measured using the Investigator's Global Atopic Dermatitis Assessment (IGADA). An assessment of atopic dermatitis based on a 4 point scale, ranging from 0 (none) and 3 (severe), is used to describe signs and symptoms in 4 designated body regions. Based on the presence or absence of the total number of signs and symptoms, the final rating is categorized as clear, almost clear, mild, moderate, severe, or very severe.

outcomeMeasures.title: Eczema Area and Severity Index (EASI) on Day 1 - Change From Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: The surface and severity of eczema is measured using the Eczema Area and Severity Index (EASI). A regional body surface area tabulation based on severity ranging from 0 (none) to 3 (severe), and severity of signs of disease, then multiplied by body area with final calculation ranging from 0-72.

outcomeMeasures.title: Corneometer Measurement on Day 0 - Post-Treatment - Change From Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: Corneometer is a non-invasive instrument that measures hydration on the skin surface. During assessment, the corneometer was placed at a site adjacent to eczema-affected skin areas. Corneometer readings are directly related to the skin's electrical capacitance and increase as the skin becomes more hydrated. Pre-treatment readings ranged from 2.0 to 68.0. Post-treatment on Day 0, corneometer readings ranged from 10.3 to 86.3.

outcomeMeasures.title: Corneometer Measurement on Day 1 - Change From Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: Corneometer is a non-invasive instrument that measures hydration on the skin surface. During assessment, the corneometer was placed at a site adjacent to eczema-affected skin areas. Corneometer readings are directly related to the skin's electrical capacitance and increase as the skin becomes more hydrated. Pre-treatment readings ranged from 2.0 to 68.0. On Day 1, corneometer readings ranged from 5.5 to 84.0.

outcomeMeasures.description: Corneometer is a non-invasive instrument that measures hydration on the skin surface. outcomeMeasures.title: Corneometer Measurement on Day 14 - Change From Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: Corneometer is a non-invasive instrument that measures hydration on the skin surface. outcomeMeasures.title: Caregiver Questionnaire on Day 0 Pre-treatment - Overall, my Baby's Skin Looks Smooth
outcomeMeasures.description: Questions were answered before treatment by participant's caregiver. Questions included overall look (smooth, healthy) and feel (soft, smooth) of participant's skin, and affected area's look (smooth, healthy) and feel (soft, smooth). Caregiver answered based on a 6 point system from 'I don't have an opinion' to 'strongly disagree.'

outcomeMeasures.description: Questions were answered immediately post-treatment by participant's caregiver. Questions included overall look (smooth, healthy) and feel (soft, smooth) of participant's skin, and affected area's look (smooth, healthy) and feel (soft, smooth). Caregiver answered based on a 6 point system from 'I don't have an opinion' to 'strongly disagree.'
